page.title: 04FARMER'S WIFE - INTERVIEW
page.content: We interviewed a farmer's wife who also teaches at Wingate County Junior School. Her husband farms one of the Stotfold Farms. The farm dates back to the 1700s. The present owners have been living there for 14 years and farm 250 acres of land. For the farmer's wife the day begins at 7am. She feeds the animals and then sets off for school to reach there for 9am. She leaves school at 3.45pm to go home. When she arrives she looks after her horses and feeds the other animals again. They have 3 horses, 4 cats, a dog,hamsters and rabbits for pets. The greatest problem with the animals is when baby calves get diarrhea and upset stomachs. The farmer's wife teaches riding at her farm as a hobby ands also helps at the nearbye Indoor Riding Centre.
